headline: Stocks fall, growth in e-commerce: Morning Brief
summary: Today on Morning Brief, Co-hosts Seana Smith and Brad Smith discussed market movers with expert guests and the trending tickers of the day, including Amazon (AMZN) and Apple (AAPL).All three of the major indexes (^DJI,^GSPC, ^IXIC) opened lower Friday morning as post-Trump victory gains begin to fade. Data Editor Jared Blikre breaks down the action at the open. October retail sales are up by 0.4%, driven by strong e-commerce with Amazon’s Prime Deal Days playing a key role. LSEG director of consumer research Jharonne Martis highlights that Walmart is becoming a strong competitor to Amazon, offering flexible shopping options for consumers. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) recently disclosed a 1.3 million stake in Domino's Pizza (DPZ) and a 1% stake in Pool Corp. (POOL), valued at $550 million and $152 million, respectively.Super Micro Computer (SMCI) risks delisting from the Nasdaq due to delays in filing financial statements. Defiance ETFs CEO and CIO Sylvia Jablonski discusses the company's outlook, noting that the report is coming at a bad time given its strong position in the market.For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here. This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: Buffett’s Berkshire bets on Domino’s and Pool Corp.
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) recently disclosed stakes in Domino's Pizza (DPZ) and Pool Corp. (POOL). Berkshire bought 1.3 million shares in Domino’s — now a 3.6% stake, valued at $550 million following recent comments and stronger-than-expected retail sales — and a 1% stake in Pool Corp, valued at $152 million.Morning Brief Anchors Seana Smith and Brad Smith break down Buffett’s investments and his confidence in consumer resilience, particularly in food and retail sectors.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: Domino's Stock Rallies After Berkshire Hathaway Takes Slice
summary: Shares of Domino's Pizza jumped after Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a new position in the chain. The investment conglomerate also took a stake in Pool Corp., and cut its position in Ulta Beauty.
